modules.title: Openings
modules.summary: Build a strong foundation by developing pieces, controlling the center, and safeguarding the king.

exercises.title: Claim the center
exercises.prompt: Choose a central pawn advance that stakes space and opens development.
exercises.explanation: Great start! Central pawns open lines for the bishops and queen.

exercises.title: Develop a minor piece
exercises.prompt: Bring a knight into play without moving the same piece twice.
exercises.explanation: Perfect! Knights develop naturally to f3 or c3.

modules.title: Tactics
modules.summary: Spot forcing moves to win material or deliver checkmate.

exercises.title: Mate in one
exercises.prompt: Find the immediate checkmate against the exposed king.
exercises.explanation: Mate! The queen covers all escape squares with Qg7#.

exercises.title: Win the queen
exercises.prompt: Play the skewer that wins material.
exercises.explanation: Nice! Qc6+ forces the queen to block, winning it next.

modules.title: Endgames
modules.summary: Convert small advantages with king activity and precise pawn play.

exercises.title: Advance the passer
exercises.prompt: Push the passed pawn to gain ground while your king supports.
exercises.explanation: Great! The pawn advance gains space and limits the king.

exercises.title: Activate the king
exercises.prompt: Centralize your king to support the pawn race.
exercises.explanation: Nice king move! Centralizing helps escort the pawn.
